conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces are visible, and the view is angled with the ceiling removed to expose interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable interior volume; angled/isometric view with clean cutaway. Minor limitations: simplified corner/edge detailing and limited floor-vs-wall material separation.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room zoning roughly matches (living left, bedroom right, service core near top), but the balcony from the 2D plan is not represented, and kitchen/utility/toilet partitions and proportions appear simplified and not tightly aligned to the 2D layout.

interior_elements.notes: Bed and dining table are present; kitchen/bath fixtures are very minimal/unclear (toilet/sink not clearly identifiable), and several expected elements (sofa, clear kitchen run, utility appliances) are missing or overly abstract.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clean and readable with unobstructed view; lighting is adequate. However, openings (windows/doors) are not clearly modeled and the presentation is very sparse, reducing interpretability of exact plan fidelity.

detected_errors.description: Balcony shown in the 2D plan is missing/not modeled in the 3D render, and several room proportions/partitions (kitchen/utility/toilet core) appear distorted or overly simplified.
Doors/windows are not clearly placed or do not visibly correspond to the 2D plan's opening locations.
Furniture/fixtures are incomplete: kitchen and bathroom elements are not clearly represented; living room seating arrangement is largely absent.
Minimal materials/details reduce the ability to verify fine-grain alignment (wall segments and openings) against the 2D plan.

summary: A legitimate 3D cutaway is produced, but key layout fidelity issues (notably the missing balcony and simplified service-core geometry) prevent a higher accuracy rating.
